{{Use Indian English|date=May 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2014}} The 52nd [[Da'i al-Mutlaq]] of the [[Dawoodi Bohras]], Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]], died in January 2014.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/660017/leader-of-bohra-community-dr-syedna-mohammed-burhanuddin-dead-at-102/|title=Leader of Bohra community Dr Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin dead at 102|last=|first=|date=|website= The Express Tribune|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref> As per the tenets of the sect<ref>{{cite book |last= Blank |first= Jonah |date= 2001 |title= Mullahs on the Mainframe : Islam and Modernity Among the Daudi Bohras |url= |location= |publisher= University of Chicago Press; 1 edition (15 April 2001) |page= 135 & 165 |isbn= 978-0-226-05676-0}}</ref> each predecessor is required to nominate his successor prior to his death.<ref>{{cite book |last= Daftary |first= Farhad |date= 2007 |title= The Isma'ilis: Their History and Doctrines |url= |location= |publisher= Cambridge University Press |page= 275 |isbn= 1-139-46578-3}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |last= Daftary |first= Farhad |date= 2011 |title= A Modern History of the Ismailis: Continuity and Change in a Muslim Community |url= |location= |publisher= I. B. Tauris |page= 333 |isbn= 1-84511-717-4}}</ref> His death sparked a succession crisis where two rival claimants emerged for the title of 53rd Dā'ī al-Mutlaq:<ref name="Huff Post">{{cite news | url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/rizwan-mawani/the-intricacies-of-succes_b_4687546.html | title=The Intricacies of Succession: Two Claimants Emerge for Dawoodi Bohra Leadership |work=[[The Huffington Post]] | date=30 January 2014 | accessdate=11 February 2014 | first=Rizwan | last=Mawani}}</ref> his son, [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]], and his half-brother, [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]], who was previously ''Mazoon'' (first assistant to the Dā'ī)<ref>{{cite book |last=Blank |first=Jonah |date= 2001 |title= Mullahs on the Mainframe: Islam and Modernity Among the Daudi Bohras |url= https://books.google.co.in/books?id=r_FExBRnC3YC&pg=PA163&lpg=PA163 |location= |publisher= The University of Chicago Press |page= 163 |isbn= 0-226-05676-7}}</ref> of the Dawoodi Bohra.<ref name="rift">{{cite news|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/mumbai/talk-of-rift-among-bohras-over-syedna-s-successor/article1-1044475.aspx|title=Talk of rift among Bohras over Syedna's successor|date=15 April 2013|newspaper=Hindustan Times|access-date=23 August 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140326095043/http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/mumbai/talk-of-rift-among-bohras-over-syedna-s-successor/article1-1044475.aspx|archive-date=26 March 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Prior to 2014, [[Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin]] suffered a stroke in a [[London]] on 1 June 2011<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Syedna-suffers-stroke-names-son-successor/articleshow/8754141.cms|title=Syedna suffers stroke, names son successor|date=7 June 2011|work=}}</ref> and on 4 June 2011, [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] was named his successor.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Syedna-suffers-stroke-names-son-successor/articleshow/8754141.cms|title=Syedna suffers stroke, names son successor – Times of India|access-date=2016-07-13}}</ref> Following this, [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] assumed this role as the successor and his appointment was welcomed by the [[Dawoodi Bohra]] community.<ref name=":11">{{Cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/mumbai/dawoodi-bohras-welcome-nomination-of-successor/story-iUt3hoylSKVRYz1oJgtJVP.html|title=Dawoodi Bohras welcome nomination of successor|date=2011-06-07|access-date=2016-07-13}}</ref> In the [[Dawoodi Bohra]] [[Mithaq]] (oath of allegiance), [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]]'s name was taken alongside Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]]'s.<ref name=":02" /> Together,<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-surat-to-host-dr-syedna-saheb-s-101st-birthday-1661054|title=Surat to host Dr Syedna Saheb's 101st birthday {{!}} Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis|date=2012-03-11|language=en-US|access-date=2016-07-13}}</ref><ref name=":322">{{Cite web|url=http://udaipurtimes.com/bohras-celebrated-101-birthday-of-syedna/|title=Bohras Celebrated 101 Birthday of Syedna|date=2012-03-14|language=en-US|access-date=2016-07-13}}</ref> [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] and [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] traveled the globe<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=http://www.khaleejtimes.com/article/20121014/ARTICLE/310149904/1002|title=Bohra leader in Dubai on way to Madinah – Khaleej Times|last=Reporter|first=Staff|website=www.khaleejtimes.com|access-date=2016-07-13}}</ref><ref name=":5">{{Cite web|url=http://www.ft.lk/article/110297/Successor-to-Bohra-Leader-arrives-in-Sri-Lanka|title=Successor to Bohra Leader arrives in Sri Lanka|access-date=2016-07-13}}</ref> looking after the affairs<ref name=":62">{{Cite web|url=http://udaipurtimes.com/syedi-mufaddal-bhaisaheb-addresses-chehlum-waaz/|title=Syedi Mufaddal Bhaisaheb addresses Chehlum Waaz {{!}} UdaipurTimes.com|date=2013-12-23|language=en-US|access-date=2016-07-13}}</ref> of the community<ref name=":7">{{Cite web|url=http://www.khaleejtimes.com/article/20130711/ARTICLE/307119846/1002|title=Bohra leader welcomed – Khaleej Times|last=Reporter)|first=(Staff|website=www.khaleejtimes.com|access-date=2016-07-13}}</ref><ref name=":82">{{Cite web|url=http://udaipurtimes.com/dawoodi-bohra-priest-arrives-in-udaipur/|title=Dawoodi Bohra Priest arrives in Udaipur {{!}} UdaipurTimes.com|date=2013-12-22|language=en-US|access-date=2016-07-13}}</ref> up until 2014.
Following the Syedna's death, Mufaddal took up the office of [[Da'i al-Mutlaq]], as per the appointment by Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.firstpost.com/india/mumbai-mourns-syedna-mohammed-burhanuddins-demise-1346039.html|title=Mumbai mourns Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin's demise|work=First Post}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=obotsYGvlIw|title=Live : Dr Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin's final journey|work=News Express}}</ref> [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin|Khuzaima Qutubuddin]] claiming to have been appointed heir 50 years earlier in secrecy,<ref name="Huff Post" /><ref name="hindustantimes.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/mumbai/talk-of-rift-among-bohras-over-syedna-s-successor/article1-1044475.aspx|title=Talk of rift among Bohras over Syedna's successor|accessdate=26 March 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140326095043/http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/mumbai/talk-of-rift-among-bohras-over-syedna-s-successor/article1-1044475.aspx|archive-date=26 March 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> challenged Mufaddal's right to be Dai in court.<ref>http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-claimant-to-syedna-seat-declares-official-challenge-1968682, 'but this has been challenged by Khuzaima'</ref> He also took office as the 53rd Dā'ī of Dawoodi Bohras with two headquarters, the primary being in Darus Sakina in Thane and the other in Saifee Mahal where Mufaddal resides.<ref name="press release">{{cite web | url=http://fatemidawat.files.wordpress.com/2014/04/press-statement-april2014.pdf | title=Commencement of Legal Action by His Holiness Syedna Khuzaima Qutbuddin TUS, being the 53rd Dai al-Mutlaq and Head of the Dawoodi Bohra Community Against The False Claimant Shehzada Mufaddal Saifuddin: For Truth, Justice and Future of the Dawoodi Bohra Community | accessdate=3 December 2014}}</ref>
The challenge created a divide in the community with the vast majority aligning with [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2014-01-29/pune/46781344_1_pune-cantonment-peace-march-dawoodi-bohras|title= Dawoodi Bohras stage a peace march|date= |work=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-bohras-make-anti-syedna-faction-s-ex-communication-official-stick-by-mufaddal-saifuddin-1958375|title= Bohras make anti-Syedna faction's ex-communication official, stick by Mufaddal Saifuddin |date= |work=}}</ref> whilst a small but not insignificant number aligned with [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Breakaway-Dawoodi-Bohra-faction-alleges-harassment/articleshow/29874753.cms?referral=PM|title="Over 200 people attended the Mumbai 'misaaq'" - Breakaway Dawoodi Bohra faction alleges harassment |date= |work=}}</ref> [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] assumed control of the [[Dawoodi Bohra]] administration and infrastructure. He is largely accepted as the Bohras' leader<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ismailignosis.com/2014/07/05/what-is-shia-islam-a-visual-chart-of-different-shia-communities/|title=What is Shia Islam? A Visual Chart of Different Shia Communities|last=Gnostic|first=Ismaili|date=2014-07-05|website=Ismaili Gnosis|access-date=2016-06-15}}</ref> by government and other public bodies.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://themuslim500.com/downloads/2011-low.pdf|title=500 muslims|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref> The UK Charity Commission<ref name=":35" /> has stated in writing, that "our view is that His Holiness Syedna Mufaddal Saifuddin is the current incumbent of the office of Dai al-Mutlaq."<ref name=":34">{{cite news|last1=Waring |first1= Kate|title= UK Charity Commission's View regarding The Dawat-e-Hadiyah Trust |url= |accessdate= |publisher= Herbert Smith Freehills Solicitors and Nabarro Solicitors (Charity Commission) |date=15 August 2014}}</ref>
The issue is also historic in the sense that similar [[Dawoodi Bohra#Intra-Bohra schisms|case]] was put up in the court of Mughal emperor [[Akbar]], in year 1591AD, where succession was challenged.<ref>[https://www.hindustantimes.com/kolkata/unique-case-from-akbar-s-court-in-1591-to-bombay-hc/story-u4QNPgu4wyYETNUSa2mjVN.html]; Unique case: From Akbar’s court in 1591 to Bombay HC </ref> There is also a unique case ([[Chandabhoy Galla Case]]) filed in the British time court in Mumbai, in 1917 and decided in 1921, where claim was based on modality of succession earlier done. In the both of these case challenger were defeated, Syedna [[Dawood Bin Qutubshah]] remained Dai in 1591AD<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20010210004257/http://www.bohra.net/archive/ahmedabad.html]; History of Duat Mutlakin's of Ahmedabad</ref> and, ownership of the Chandabhoy Galla remained with Syedna [[Taher Saifuddin]]. <ref>[https://books.google.co.in/books?isbn=0857735268]; History A Modern History of the Ismailis: Continuity and Change in a Muslim Community; edited by Farhad Daftary 2010 - Social Science; 'legal battle with dissidents:-chandbhai case, internal dissent: legitimacy of nass on abdul qadi nazmuddin –nazim dai 50 yearts' </ref>
== Overview ==
=== Mufaddal Saifuddin's Position === [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] states that he has been appointed a number of times in presence of multiple witnesses.<ref name="His Holiness 615">{{cite book |last= His Holiness |first= Syedna Aali Qadr Mufaddal Saifuddin Saheb |date= 1436H |title= رسالة اننعي المسماة - حكمة الغيبة القدسانية الابدية |url= |location= |publisher= His Holiness Syedna Aali Qadr Mufaddal Saifuddin Saheb, Badri Mahal, Mumbai, India |page= 615 |isbn=}}</ref> These incidences are: * On 27 January 1969 (corresponding to the night of 11th Zil Qa'dah 1388 H) – in the presence of Sh Ibrahim Yamani, Sh Abdulhusain Tambawala & Sh Abdulhusein Sh Ibrahim Abdul Qadir.<ref name="His Holiness 615" /><ref name="mumbaimirror.com">{{Cite web|url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/mumbai/others/Late-Syednas-son-banishes-uncle-sets-stage-for-brother/articleshow/29622505.cms?prtpage=1|title=Late Syedna's son banishes uncle, sets stage for brother – Mumbai Mirror -|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref> This appointment is noted in a diary entry that was shown to the public on 4 February 2014 (4 Rabi al Akhar 1435H) by [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://believesyednaqutbuddin.com/2014/02/10/reason-52-the-nass-mubarak-of-syedna-mohammed-burhanuddin-al-hayy-al-muqaddas-ra/|title=THE NASS MUBARAK OF SYEDNA MOHAMMED BURHANUDDIN AL-HAYY AL-MUQADDAS RA|work=}}</ref> * On 24 October 1994 (corresponding to 20 Jumada al Ula 1415H) in the presence of Sh Abdulhusain Yamani.<ref name="His Holiness 615" /> * In October/November 2005, during the month of Ramadan 1426H, in the presence of Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]]'s eldest son [[Qaidjoher Ezzuddin]] and Malek al Ashtar Shujauddin.<ref name="His Holiness 615" /> * On 4 June 2011 (corresponding to 3 Rajab al-Asab 1432H) in [[Cromwell Hospital]], London, in the presence of 6 witnesses.<ref name="His Holiness 615" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Syedna-suffers-stroke-names-son-successor/articleshow/8754141.cms|title=Syedna suffers stroke, names son successor |date= 7 June 2011 |work=}}</ref><ref name=":0" /> * On 20 June 2011 (corresponding to 19th Rajab 1432H) in [[Raudat Tahera]] [[Mumbai]], in the presence of the entire [[Dawoodi Bohra]] community.<ref name="auto">{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ge9wG2Irv-Q|title=Nass – Raudat Tahera – 19th Rajab 1432 (Part 1) |date= |work=}}</ref> For three years from 2011 to 2014 Mufaddal Saifuddin assumed the role of Syedna's successor. In the [[Dawoodi Bohra]] [[Mithaq]] (oath of allegiance), [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]]'s name was taken alongside Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]]'s as the successor.<ref name=":02" /> Together,<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":322"/> [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] and [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] traveled the globe<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":5" /> looking after the affairs<ref name=":62"/> of the community<ref name=":7" /><ref name=":82"/> up until Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]]'s death in 2014. Henceforth, he assumed the role of the 53rd [[Da'i al-Mutlaq]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.samaa.tv/pakistan/2014/01/syedi-mufaddal-bhaisaheb-saifuddin-becomes-spiritual-leader-of-bohra-community/|title=Syedi Mufaddal Bhaisaheb Saifuddin becomes spiritual leader of Bohra community {{!}} SAMAA TV|access-date=2016-07-14}}</ref>
=== Khuzaima Qutbuddin's Claim === In 2011 up to 2014, Khuzaima Qutbuddin<ref name=":20" /><ref name=":21" /> and his family<ref name=":22" /> had publicly declared and congratulated Mufaddal Saifuddin as the successor. On a few occasions, Khuzaima Qutbuddin was seen participating in public gatherings seated below<ref name=":23" /><ref name=":24" /> Mufaddal Saifuddin. Until the Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]]'s death, there wasn't any indication of objection from [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]].
Following the Syedna's death in January 2014, [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]], who was the second in command to [[Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin]], claimed the title of the 53rd Dā'ī l-Muṭlaq of the Dawoodi Bohras. Khuzaima Qutbuddin claims that Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin performed [[Nass (Islam)|nass]] on him 49 years ago in 1965 a ritual during which he appointed him as his successor in private without any witnesses.<ref name="trouble">{{cite news|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/cities/mumbai/who-is-new-syedna-trouble-brews-as-half-brother-stakes-claim/|title=Who is new Syedna? Trouble brews as half-brother stakes claim|date=6 February 2014|work=[[The Indian Express]]|accessdate=11 February 2014}}</ref> Qutbuddin states that Syedna Burhanuddin told him that this was because otherwise, 'swords would be crossed'.
The rift between the two claimants started to appear even before the death of Burhanuddin, with followers of Khuzaima Qutbuddin rallying support for Khuzaima.<ref name="rift" /> A group formed in 2013 in support of Burhanuddin's half-brother [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]], who was Mazoon, serving second under Dai al Mutlaq.<ref name="rift" /> Khuzaima has denied formation of any separate sect by publishing a public affidavit.{{citation needed|date=July 2016|reason= Is there any source for this affidavit?}}
[[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]] died on 30 March 2016. On 31 March 2016 the family of [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]] released a statement that Khuzaima Qutbuddin had conferred nass (announcement of successor) on his son [[Taher Fakhruddin]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asianage.com/mumbai/syedna-s-death-won-t-affect-succession-row-high-court-717|title=Syedna's death won't affect succession row in High Court|work=[[The Asian Age]]}}</ref>
== Chronological Account of the events in 2011 ==
=== The Events of 4 June 2011 === On 4 June 2011 (corresponding to 3 Rajab al-Asab 1432H), His Holiness Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] gathered three of his sons (commonly referred to as Shehzadas), namely Qusai, Idris and Ammar; his daughter Husaina; son in law Dr Moiz, and grandson Abdul Qadir to his room at [[Cromwell Hospital]]. He made a declaration appointing his son [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] as his successor, and instructed them to inform the [[Dawoodi Bohra]] community.<ref name=":0">{{cite news|last1=|first1= |title= مثال - نص داعي الطيب منصور اليمن على المولى عقيق اليمن - 19 شهر رمضان 1432هـ |url= |accessdate= |publisher=Alvazaratus Saifiyah |date=2011}}</ref> Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] then summoned [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] and his eldest son [[Qaidjoher Ezzuddin]] to [[Cromwell Hospital]], where a short [[Majlis]] was held in [[Cromwell Hospital]], Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] was congratulated on his appointment, drank [[sharbat|sherbet]] and everyone present performed [[Š-L-M|salaam]] to Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] and [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]].<ref name=":0" />
These sequence of events were cited in a [[Majlis]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zeninfosys.net/zen/sites/default/files/styles/akhbar-popup/public/photos/akhbar/saadat-kiraam/2011-06/7488/05-06-2011-123750-IMG_9974_2.jpg?itok=UDOwbPfU|title=Shz Qaid Joher Bs DM Presided over Urs Majlis of Seyedna Nurmohammed Nooruddin Gallery I|date=5 June 2011|work=Zeninfosys – Al Jamea tus Saifiyah}}</ref> held by [[Qaidjoher Ezzuddin]] in al Masjid ul Husseini<ref name=":27">{{cite web|url=http://mosques.muslimsinbritain.org/maps.php#/mosque/1546|title=al Masjid ul Husseini -Northolt, London|date=|work=Muslims in Britain}}</ref> in [[Northolt]]; [[London]] on 5 June 2011. The video of this [[Majlis]] was recorded and was broadcast on the same day in [[Dawoodi Bohra]] community centers worldwide.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dnasyndication.com/showarticlerss.aspx?nid=ZZXvspMsMOCU1SgaITYLM8ZGplAN5KAi0wkQGEuEWEE=|title='Attended majlis where successor was announced'|date=30 July 2015|work=DNA Syndication}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://believesyednaqutbuddin.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/tahiyaat_then.jpg|title= 5th June Majlis Relay |date= |work=Tayiyaat.com}}</ref> These events were also documented in an official report (Arabic: مثال) by the office of His Holiness,<ref name=":0" /> Alvazaratus Saifiyah.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.alvazarat.org|title= Alvazaratus Saifiyah |date= |work=Tayiyaat.com}}</ref> This document was published and distributed to entire [[Dawoodi Bohra]] community during the month of [[Radaman]] in 2011.
[[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]] challenged this ascension and claimed that Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] was too ill to have spoken coherently, and medically unfit to move or drink [[sharbat|sherbet]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/mumbai/others/Late-Syedna-too-ill-to-have-spoken-coherently/articleshow/33144765.cms|title= LATE SYEDNA 'TOO ILL TO HAVE SPOKEN COHERENTLY' |date= |work=}}</ref>
In reply to these allegations, an audio recording of the appointment, and a video recording of the [[Majlis]] in [[Cromwell Hospital]] was shown to the entire [[Dawoodi Bohra]] community on 18 May 2014 (corresponding to 19 Rajab al Asab 1435H). This video confirmed Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] speaking coherently to his family, drinking [[sharbat|sherbet]] and presiding over the [[Majlis]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dawoodi-bohras.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=1&t=10277&sid=cfd77d27f5f6babe9fe98fe6b131075a|title= Audio/Video clips on Nass |date= |work=}}</ref> therefore affirming the events described by [[Qaidjoher Ezzuddin]] and the Alvazaratus Saifiyah document.<ref name=":0" /> Qutbuddin has not responded to this video.
==== Syedna's Medical Condition ==== At the time of Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]]'s stroke his sons, attendant physician and son-in-law, Dr Moiz bhaisaheb and surviving daughter were present in London with him along with other close family members. Neither Qutbuddin nor his family were present before or subsequently.
The medical report presented by Khuzaima Qutbuddin explicitly ruled out the possibility of the Syedna having any ability to coherently speak or move.<ref name="perilous">{{cite web|url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/mumbai/cover-story/A-perilous-transition/articleshow/29266169.cms|title=A perilous transition|date=2014-01-24|publisher=Mumbai Mirror|accessdate=2014-04-04}}</ref><ref name="mumbaimirrorill">{{cite web|url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/mumbai/others/Late-Syedna-too-ill-to-have-spoken-coherently/articleshow/33144765.cms |title=Late Syedna 'too ill to have spoken coherently' |work=Mumbai Mirror |date=2014-04-03 |accessdate=2014-04-04 |publisher=[[The Times Group]]}}</ref><ref name="DNA Nass Article">{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report_successor-to-syedna-mohammed-burhanuddin-named_1551640|title=Successor to Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin named|work=dna}}</ref> The review<ref name="mumbaimirrorill" /> was done by Dr Daniel Mankens,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://doctors.beaumont.org/provider/Daniel+H+Arndt/227272 |title= Dr Daniel Menkes |date= |work=}}</ref> chairman of Neurology Beaumont Hospital, Michigan. He writes, 'It is inconceivable that someone his age and with neurological deficits would have such a profound, yet transient recovery.' He goes on to say that 'family members usually report even the slightest improvement to medical staff. It surprises me that such an event would not be documented in the medical record, much less reported to the medical staff'. Based on this review report, Qutbuddin claimed that 'the succession was not done in London Hospital' as Mohammad Burhanuddin suffered from a 'full stroke at the age of 100 that made it difficult for him to write, speak, or move'.<ref name="mumbaimirrorill" /><ref name="mumbaimirror1">{{cite web|url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/mumbai/others/Dawoodi-Bohra-succession-battle-takes-legal-turn/articleshow/33092989.cms |title=Dawoodi Bohra succession battle takes legal turn |work=Mumbai Mirror |date=2014-04-02 |accessdate=2014-04-04 | publisher=[[The Times Group]]}}</ref>
The doctors behind these reports had never met nor treated Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] at any time and gave their opinions based on medical reports and the explanations provided by [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]].
Meanwhile, the specialists who treated, attended to Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] and who actually wrote the medical reports do not agree with these opinions. Dr John Francis Costello;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bupacromwellhospital.com/find-a-doctor/find-a-consultant/john-costello/ |title= Dr John Costello |date= |work=}}</ref> Consultant in Respiratory Medicine, and Neurologist Dr Omar Malik,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bupacromwellhospital.com/find-a-doctor/find-a-consultant/omar-malik/ |title= Dr Omar Malik |date= |work=}}</ref> both who had attended to Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] at [[Cromwell Hospital]] in London have stated, in writing, that His Holiness was capable of making the declaration and of conducting a ceremony, even though his speech was slurred.<ref name=":12" /><ref name=":15">{{cite news|last1=Malik |first1= Dr Omar|title= Letter – Neurological assessment and management of His Holiness between 01 June 2011 and over the subsequent 96 hours |url= |accessdate= |publisher= Dr Omar Malik, PHD, FRCP – Consultant Neurologist (GMC No:3276389) |date=17 April 2014}}</ref> Further, Dr Costello stated that he believes the report provided by the USA doctor Dr Daniel Menkes is incorrect.<ref name=":12">{{cite news|last1=Francis Costello |first1= John|title= Letter – Summary of my view on the state of His Holiness's health in June 2011 |url= |accessdate= |publisher=Notarized by Sarah Karen Mackie England Notary Public |date=17 April 2014}}</ref> He confirmed that his patient, Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] indeed did communicate his wishes on a variety of issues during his admission.<ref name=":12" />
On 4 June, the day of the [[Nass (Islam)|Nass]] in question, Dr Costello noted that there was evidence of continued improvement in Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]]'s health<ref name=":12" /> He confirmed that although he did not witness the said [[Nass (Islam)|Nass]], there was no doubt that Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] was able to effectively communicate his wishes whilst at [[Cromwell Hospital]], particularly in his mother toungue [[Lisan al-Dawat]].<ref name=":12" />
In regards to His Holiness's intellective state, both Dr Costello and Dr Malik confirmed that he was of sound cognitive state, and that he was able to clearly communicate with his family and medical staff.<ref name=":12" /><ref name=":15" /> In regards to the reports by the USA doctors, Dr Omar denied there was any evidence of a receptive speech problem.<ref name=":15" /> Dr Costello further expresses he felt a special connection with His Holiness as he often greet him with a smile of recognition, looked him in the eye, interacted in English, and even become lively at times.<ref name=":12" />
A year later in 2012, Dr Costello was invited on stage to meet Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin. In his medical report<ref name=":12" /> he notes that Syedna instantly smiled at him with recognition, and shook his hand for a lengthy time.<ref name=":13">{{Cite web|url=http://zeninfosys.net/zen/sites/default/files/styles/akhbar-popup/public/photos/akhbar/huzurala-tus/2012-07/15080/13-07-2012-217907-img88380.jpg?itok=qqyJnfO6|title=SMB meeting with Dr Costello|last=|first=|date=14 July 2012|website=|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref><ref name=":14">{{Cite web|url=http://zeninfosys.net/zen/sites/default/files/styles/akhbar-popup/public/photos/akhbar/huzurala-tus/2012-07/15080/13-07-2012-217908-img88400.jpg?itok=8EW70ED6|title=SMB shaking hands with Dri Costello|last=|first=|date=14 July 2012|website=|publisher=Zeninfosys|access-date=}}</ref>
These reports were submitted in court in the sworn affidavit submitted by Shehzada [[Qaidjoher Ezzuddin]] the eldest son of Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] before the [[Mumbai High Court|Bombay High Court]].
=== The Raudat Tahera Ceremony === On 8 June 2011, Dr John Francis Costello noted improvements in His Holiness's health and there were discussions about his wishes to travel to [[Mumbai]] for to attend the death anniversary of his father Syedna [[Taher Saifuddin]]<ref name=":12" /> which was to be held on 20 June 2011. By 15 June 2011, there was further improvement. Dr John Francis Costello approved of sending His Holiness to [[Mumbai]] in an air ambulance as it was deemed safe and appropriate.<ref name=":12" /> On this day, Dr Costello recalls having a short coherent conversation in English with His Holiness about his journey to [[Mumbai]].<ref name=":12" /> On 17 June 2011, His Holiness was discharged from [[Cromwell Hospital]] and traveled to Mumbai, as planned, in an air ambulance.<ref name=":12" /> These sequence of events, His Holiness's wishes to travel and the doctor's approval are of paramount significance because the group loyal to Qutbuddin allege that His Holiness was forced to travel against his own will despite suffering a stroke. Dr Costello's letter proves otherwise.
A ceremony was arranged in [[Raudat Tahera]] [[Mumbai]] on 20 June 2011 (corresponding to 19th Rajab 1432H) to declare [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] as the Dā'ī.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ge9wG2Irv-Q|title=Nass – Raudat Tahera – 19th Rajab 1432 (Part 1)|date=|work=}}</ref> The entire ceremony was recorded and was broadcast on the same day to Dawoodi Bohra community centers worldwide. This video was posted by Qutbuddin's website and re-posted by another [[Youtube]] user.<ref name="auto" /> Images of this ceremony are also available online.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://qutbibohras.blogspot.com/2014/12/guidance-through-history.html|title=Qutbi Bohras: Guidance through history|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref>
== Events following the succession (2011-2014) ==
=== Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin's activities after the succession === From 2011 up to 2014, Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin, despite his stroke, went on pilgrimages, traveled across India, overseas, and presided over many community gatherings.

In the [[Hijri]] year of 1433H (November 2011), Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin held the [[Muharram]] gatherings in [[Mumbai]]. On 2 [[Muharram]] Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin conducted the first sermon,<ref name="zeninfosys.net">{{Cite web|url=http://zeninfosys.net/zen/sites/default/files/styles/akhbar-popup/public/photos/akhbar/huzurala-tus/2011-11/9947/26-11-2011-150851-mg0086.jpg?itok=7W96hqw_|title=Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin first sermon (waaz) in Muharram 1433H.|last=|first=|date=|website=Zeninfosys|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref> and presided over every [[Majlis]] at night until [[Day of Ashura|Ashura]] of 1432H. === Mufaddal Saifuddin's activities after the succession === [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] assumed this role as the successor of Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] and his appointment was welcomed by the [[Dawoodi Bohra]] community.<ref name=":11" /> Together, [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] and [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] undertook the leadership after the affairs of the community.
On 9 June 2011, then [[Chief Minister of Gujarat]], [[Narendra Modi]] congratulated [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] on his succession.<ref name=":9">{{cite news|url=|title=Letter – Narendra Modi to Mufaddal Saifuddin – Congratulations on Succession|last=|first=|date=9 June 2011|work=|publisher=|access-date=|via=|last1=Modi|first1=Narendra|accessdate=}}</ref> On 15 June 2011 the office of Syenda [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]], The Alvazaratus Saifiyah<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.alvazarat.org|title=Alvazaratus Saifiyah|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|access-date=|work=Alvazaratus Saifiyah}}</ref> instructed [[Dawoodi Bohra]]s to take [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]]'s name alongside Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]]'s as the successor in their [[Mithaq]] (oath of allegiance).<ref name=":02">{{cite news|url=|title=مثال شريف - عبارة عهد الاولياء و الرقعة - 24 شهر رحب الاصب 1432هـ|date=2011|publisher=Alvazaratus Saifiyah|last1=|first1=|accessdate=}}</ref>
A month later, in [[Sha'ban]], [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] led the examinations of [[Al Jamea tus Saifiyah]] on behalf of Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]]. Until the Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]]'s death, there wasn't any indication of objection from [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]].
== Events following Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin's death ==
Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] died on 17 January 2014 <sup>[1]</sup> (corresponding to 16 Rabi al Awwal 1435H) in [[Mumbai]], India.
[[Mufaddal Saifuddin]], who had already been publicly appointed and accepted as the successor, assumed the position of the 53rd [[Da'i al-Mutlaq]] of the [[Dawoodi Bohra]] community.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.samaa.tv/pakistan/2014/01/syedi-mufaddal-bhaisaheb-saifuddin-becomes-spiritual-leader-of-bohra-community/|title=Syedi Mufaddal Bhaisaheb Saifuddin becomes spiritual leader of Bohra community {{!}} SAMAA TV|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref> Saifuddin was in [[Colombo]] at the time and immediately traveled to [[Mumbai]] via [[Chennai]]. He conducted his first [[Jumu'ah]] [[Salah]] in [[Sri Lanka]] and arrived in Saify Mahal,<ref name=":03">{{Cite web|url=http://wikimapia.org/7261856/Saifee-Mahal|title=Saifee Mahal – Wikimapia|website=wikimapia.org|access-date=2016-07-18}}</ref> [[Mumbai]] that evening to conduct and lead the [[Janaza]] and funeral rites. [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]], who at the time was already in Saify Mahal,<ref name=":03" /> [[Mumbai]], left for his residence in [[Thane]] prior to [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]]'s arrival.<ref name=":16">{{Cite web|url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/mumbai/cover-story/A-perilous-transition/articleshow/29266169.cms|title=A perilous transition – Mumbai Mirror -|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref> [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] led the [[Janaza]] rites throughout the night.<ref name=":16" /> and thousands of mourners attended the funeral on Saturday 18 January 2016 led by [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://zeenews.india.com/news/maharashtra/syedna-mohammed-burhanuddin-laid-to-rest-in-mumbai-70000-mourners-attend-funeral_904988.html|title=Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin laid to rest in Mumbai, 70,000 mourners attend funeral|date=2014-01-18|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.gettyimages.com/pictures/bohri-muslim-community-gathers-for-the-funeral-of-102-year-news-photo-463478931#bohri-muslim-community-gathers-for-the-funeral-of-102yearold-dawoodi-picture-id463478931|title=Dawoodi Bohra Community Spiritual Leader Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin Passes Away Pictures {{!}} Getty Images|language=en-US|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/mumbai/others/Bohras-go-e-way-to-prevent-tragedy/articleshow/29095156.cms?prtpage=1|title=Bohras go e-way to prevent tragedy – Mumbai Mirror -|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref>
On the morning of Saturday 18 January, as the [[Janaza]] left Saify Mahal en route to [[Raudat Tahera]] for burial, Khuzaima Qutbuddin sent out an email campaign to Dawoodi Bohra Community members attaching a [[PDF]] letter addressed to [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] stating his claim.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Qutbuddin|first=Khuzaima|date=18 Jan 2011|title=URGENT letter for Shz Mufaddal bs|url=|journal=|volume=|issue=|doi=|pmid=|access-date=|via=}}</ref> That evening, around 36 hours after Syedna's death, Qutbuddin posted a [[YouTube]] video of himself on his website claiming that he was the 53rd [[Da'i al-Mutlaq]], having been appointed in total secrecy in 1965.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fatemidawat.com |title=Fatemi Dawat – Dawat-e-Hadiyah Website {{!}} Website administered by the office of Syedna Khuzaima Qutbuddin TUS, leader of the Dawoodi Bohra community |date=2014-01-18 |access-date=2016-07-19 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140118161428/http://fatemidawat.com/ |archivedate=18 January 2014 |df=dmy }}</ref>
On 20 January 2016, Khuzaima Qutbuddin's name was removed [[Dawoodi Bohra]] from all official community records as the Mazoon.<ref>{{Cite book|title=Mithaal Shareef (18 Rabi Awwal 1435H) – 20 January 2014|last=|first=|publisher=Alvazaratus Saifiyah|year=2014|isbn=|location=|pages=|via=}}</ref> Following that, on 24 January 2016, [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]] issued a Public Notice<ref name=":92">{{Cite web|url=http://www.fatemidawat.com/news/media/press-releases/public-notice-jan-17-2014.html|title=Fatemi Dawat {{!}} Press Release – Public Notice: January 26, 2014|website=www.fatemidawat.com|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref> claiming that he was the sole Trustee of all the Wakfs/Trusts of the Dawoodi Bohra Community.<ref name=":92" /><ref name=":18">{{Cite web|url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/mumbai/others/Sons-loyalists-knock-doors-at-night-for-support/articleshow/29369431.cms|title=Son's loyalists knock doors at night for support – Mumbai Mirror -|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref>

citizens, professionals and intellectuals.<ref name=":17" /><ref name=":19" />
In April 2014, [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]] filed action in the [[Mumbai High Court]] against the succession of [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/New-Syednas-uncle-takes-succession-row-to-Bombay-high-court/articleshow/33095107.cms?prtpage=1|title=New Syedna's uncle takes succession row to Bombay high court – The Times of India|website=The Times of India|access-date=2016-07-19}}</ref>
== Court cases == In January 2014, Qutbuddin published a public [[affidavit]] on his website declaring his position and legal status of properties, claiming to be the sole trustee of all the trusts in the Dawoodi Bohra community.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fatemidawat.com/news-and-events/press/|title=PUBLIC NOTICE: 17th January 2014|date=17 January 2014|work=Fatemi Dawat|author=Khuzaima Qutbuddin}}</ref> Qutbuddin filed petitions against Saiffudin concerning the succession controversy in Bombay High court and Gujrat High Court. Khuzaima published a public affidavit on his website declaring his position and legal status of properties<ref name="MumabiMirror">{{cite news|url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/mumbai/others/Sons-loyalists-knock-doors-at-night-for-support/articleshow/29369431.cms|title=Son's loyalists knock doors at night for support|last=Sadhwani|first=Yogesh|date=2014-01-25|publisher=''[[Mumbai Mirror]]''|accessdate=2014-03-12}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-succession-war-breaks-out-in-syedna-mohammed-burhanuddin-s-family-1954417|title=Succession war breaks out in Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin's family | Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis|date=2014-01-21|publisher=''[[Daily News and Analysis|Dnaindia.com]]''|author=DNA Correspondent|accessdate=2014-03-23}}</ref>
=== Bombay High Court case === The late Syedna's half-brother Qutbuddin went to the High Court claiming the position of 53rd and to restrict Saifuddin from discharging the duties as the 53rd Dā'ī. The prime contention of the 700-page petition to the High Court was to have Qutbuddin, the half-brother, legally declared as the 53rd Dā'ī al-Mutlaq of the 1.2-million-strong Bohra community, while simultaneously preventing his nephew, Mufaddal Saifuddin, from acting as the Dā'ī.<ref name="mumbaimirror1" />
Justice SJ Kathawala of the Bombay High Court [[judicial disqualification|recused]] himself from hearing the suit filed by Qutbuddin as he had appeared for the late Syedna in the past, creating a conflict of interest. The Lawyers appearing for Saifuddin had no objection to Justice SJ Kathawala from hearing the suit, however Qutbuddin's lawyer Mr Kadam requested the judge to recuse himself from the case.<ref name=":36">{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Religious-matters-must-not-come-to-court-HC-judge/articleshow/33411113.cms|title=Religious matters must not come to court: HC judge - Times of India|access-date=2016-09-02}}</ref> This delayed the suit before being placed before Justice Gautam Patel at the High Court.<ref name=":36" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-bombay-high-court-judge-recuses-himself-from-hearing-syedna-successor-row-1976144|title=Bombay high court judge recuses himself from hearing Syedna successor row|date=2014-04-08|website=DNA|publisher=Diligent Media Corporation|author=<!-- Staff writer(s) -->|accessdate=2014-04-09}}</ref>
Qutbuddin sought relief including entry to Saify Mahal, the house of the community leader,filed a 700-page suit asking the court to restrain Mufaddal Saifuddin to act as the [[Da'i al-Mutlaq]]. In reply to the suit, defendant Mufaddal Saifuddin filed a detailed 494-page affidavit on 23 April 2014.<ref name=":111">{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/High-Court-willing-to-hold-daily-trial-in-Syedna-lawsuit/articleshow/36676279.cms|title=High Court willing to hold daily trial in Syedna lawsuit - Times of India|access-date=2016-09-02}}</ref> Justice Gautam Patel said it would be better to hold the trial rather than decide on interim relief.<ref name=":111"/> The Bombay High Court later agreed that it is willing to conduct a speedy, day-to-day trial<ref name=":111"/>
==== Framing of Issues ==== In September 2014, the court had framed issues in the matter, where each side will have to prove he was conferred valid nass, or the official declaration of succession.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/mumbai/bohra-succession-row-hc-to-judge-if-qutbuddin-can-prove-anointment/story-OQA3x20XwOxDrcfwxw3LbL.html|title=Bohra succession row: HC to judge if Qutbuddin can prove anointment|date=2014-09-15|access-date=2016-09-02}}</ref> The matter was then fixed for 11 December 2014, to determine the admissibility of the documents placed on record by both sides.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.pressreader.com/india/hindustan-times-st-mumbai/20141111/281951721106680|title=PressReader.com - Connecting People Through News|website=www.pressreader.com|access-date=2016-09-02}}</ref> The issues framed on 15 September 2014 in Suit No. 336 of 2014 were: * What are the requirements of a valid Nass as per the tenets of the faith?<ref name=":37">{{Cite web|url=http://fatemidawatlegal.com/all/bombay-high-court-declaratory-suit-update-15th-september-2014/|title=Bombay High Court Declaratory Suit Update: 15th September 2014 {{!}} Fatemi Dawat Legal|website=fatemidawatlegal.com|access-date=2016-09-02}}</ref> * Whether the Plaintiff proves that a valid Nass was conferred/pronounced on him as stated in the Plaint? * Whether a Nass once conferred cannot be retracted or revoked or changed or superseded? * Whether the Defendant proves that a valid Nass was conferred on him by the 52nd Dai: On 28 January 1969, in the year 2005, on 4 June 2011, On 20 June 2011 as stated in the written statement and if the answer is in the negative then whether any Nass proved on the Defendant as above consequently amounts to a retraction or revocation or change or supersession of any Nass previously conferred on the Plaintiff by the 52nd Dai?<ref name=":37" /> The case began with the new judge asking Qutbuddin, what requirements had to be fulfilled for "pronouncing a Syedna's successor", such as witnesses, publicity and acceptance by the community.<ref name=":05" /> He also asked Qutbuddin to spell out what he did to establish his right as the spiritual head since 2011 when his nephew was publicly pronounced the successor by the late Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin.<ref name=":05">{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Spell-out-steps-you-took-to-be-spiritual-head-since-2011-Bombay-HC-tells-Syednas-uncle/articleshow/34390197.cms|title=Spell out steps you took to be spiritual head since 2011, Bombay HC tells Syedna’s uncle - Times of India|access-date=2016-09-02}}</ref> This followed a reply from Saifuddin's attorney and the late Syedna's eldest son [[Qaidjoher Ezzuddin]], which contested Qutbuddin's claim.<ref name="Sequeira">{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Spell-out-steps-you-took-to-be-spiritual-head-since-2011-Bombay-HC-tells-Syednas-uncle/articleshow/34390197.cms|title=Spell out steps you took to be spiritual head since 2011, Bombay HC tells Syedna's uncle|last=Sequeira|first=Rosy|date=29 April 2014|publisher=[[The Times Group]]|location=Mumbai|work=[[The Times of India]]}}</ref><ref name="howchosen">{{cite news|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/cities/mumbai/how-is-syedna-chosen-hc-wants-to-know/|title=How is Syedna chosen? HC wants to know|date=30 April 2014|newspaper=The Indian Express}}</ref> On behalf of Mufaddal Saifuddni, Ezzuddin stated that there was "overwhelming evidence" that Saifuddin was chosen by the late Dai to be his successor and between 2011 when he was appointed the successor and in January 2014 when the 52nd Dai passed away - Saifuddin "operated within the community as the successor designate". Also, after his father's demise, Saifuddin was given misaq (oath of allegiance) by 500 Jamaats all over the world and high dignitaries.<ref name=":06">{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Spell-out-steps-you-took-to-be-spiritual-head-since-2011-Bombay-HC-tells-Syednas-uncle/articleshow/34390197.cms|title=Spell out steps you took to be spiritual head since 2011, Bombay HC tells Syedna’s uncle - Times of India|access-date=2016-09-02}}</ref>
"As per court proceedings, Qutbuddin's lawyer pointed out that Saifuddin's earlier pleading of succession was only referring the pronouncement done in year 2011 at London hospital, but after demise of late Syedna, now the case is put up in different way and now it refers that pronouncements were 'made in 1969, 1994 and 2005 and only reconfirmation was done in 2011'."<ref name="Sequeira" />
Qutbuddin alleged that "[s]ince 1980, defendant (Saifuddin) and his family implemented a devious scheme to malign him"<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mid-day.com/articles/qutbuddin-tells-hc-that-syedna-had-appointed-him-as-successor/16172176|title=Qutbuddin tells HC that Syedna had appointed him as successor|date=29 April 2015|work=[[Mid Day]]|accessdate=3 May 2015}}</ref> Justice Patel declined Kadam's plea to pass an order for access to Qutbuddin to his office in Saify Mahal and his apartment at Al Azhar. "They say they are not preventing you," said Justice Patel.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Spell-out-steps-you-took-to-be-spiritual-head-since-2011-Bombay-HC-tells-Syednas-uncle/articleshow/34390197.cms|title=Spell out steps you took to be spiritual head since 2011, Bombay HC tells Syedna’s uncle - Times of India|access-date=2016-09-07}}</ref>
==== Cross Examintation of Khuzaima Qutbuddin (Plaintiff) ==== The cross examination of Qutbuddin commenced on 27 April 2015. with Qutbuddin taking to the witness box<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/HC-restricts-entry-in-Syedna-succession-row-trial/articleshow/46607963.cms|title=HC restricts entry in Syedna succession row trial - Times of India|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref> eight times until his death.
'''1) 27 April 2015:''' Qutbuddin claimed that there were indications of support from his siblings, however none of his 20 siblings openly supported him, nor did they give their [[Mithaq]] to him.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/cities/mumbai/dawoodi-bohras-syedna-challenger-appears-in-hc-claims-support/|title=Dawoodi Bohras: Syedna challenger appears in HC, claims support|date=2015-04-28|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref>
Saifuddin's counsel Iqbal Chagla questioned Qutbuddin on the meaning of various terminologies used in the community and degrees for knowledge of scriptures awarded by [[Al Jamea tus Saifiyah]] and conferred by the Dai. Qutbuddin admitted to being conferred the degree of ''Al Aleem Al Bare'' (The Outstanding Scholar) by his father, Syedna [[Taher Saifuddin]] but denied he was conferred any degree by his late brother Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Siblings-silently-back-me-for-title-Syednas-kin/articleshow/47077519.cms|title=Siblings silently back me for title: Syedna’s kin - Times of India|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref> This was to bring forth his knowledge of Islamic studies and degrees being conferred by the principal of the Dawoodi Bohra community's educational institute.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-none-of-my-siblings-openly-support-my-claim-to-being-the-53rd-syedna-khuzaima-qutbuddin-2081251|title=None of my siblings openly support my claim to being the 53rd Syedna: Khuzaima Qutbuddin {{!}} Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis|date=2015-04-28|language=en-US|access-date=2016-09-07}}</ref> Qutbuddin also told the court that the highest title is the ''Umdat al Ulama al Muwahhadeen'' (support of unparalleled scholar), which was given to Burhanuddin by the 51st dai.<ref name=":211" />
Qutbuddin claimed that he did not challenge Saifuddin's claims at the time because he (Qutbuddin) had been asked to maintain his appointment in confidence by Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin. He prayed and hoped that "Syedna Burhanuddin Saheb would recover and set the position right in the manner he deemed appropriate".<ref name=":211">{{Cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-none-of-my-siblings-openly-support-my-claim-to-being-the-53rd-syedna-khuzaima-qutbuddin-2081251|title=None of my siblings openly support my claim to being the 53rd Syedna: Khuzaima Qutbuddin {{!}} Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis|date=2015-04-28|language=en-US|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref>
'''2) 28 April 2015:''' Qutbuddin admitted to being informed that a ''majlis'' was to be held on 6 June 2011 at Saifee Masjid and the reason for it. When asked what the reason for the ''majlis'' was, Qutbuddin replied,"The majlis was because His Holiness' health was not good and an announcement was to be made of the alleged nass conferred on the defendant (Saifuddin)." <ref name=":38">{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Prayed-for-long-life-of-Syedna-Half-brother-tells-HC/articleshow/48273001.cms|title=Prayed for long life of Syedna : Half-brother tells HC - Times of India|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref> He admitted to drinking the celebratory sherbat offered. "That was routine,<nowiki>''</nowiki> said Qutbuddin. When asked if the majlis had been convened for condolence, would sherbat have been offered, he replied,"No.<nowiki>''</nowiki> He added that the ''majlis'' was not a condolence meeting. "I did, in fact, pray for the long life of the Syedna,<nowiki>''</nowiki> he said.<ref name=":38" />
Qutbuddin also said that two attempts were made to kill him; first in Indore during Muharram and the second in Yemen,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/thesundaystandard/Kin-Clash-Over-Control-on-Rich-Dawoodi-Bohra-Community/2015/08/23/article2988141.ece|title=Kin Clash Over Control on Rich Dawoodi Bohra Community|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref> however, he named no suspects, nor dates, in court.<ref name="courtapril27">{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/news/special/court-battle-lays-bare-inner-intrigues-of-bohras-priestly-family/20150428.htm|title=Court battle lays bare inner intrigues of Bohras' priestly family|date=30 April 2015|work=[[Rediff.com]]|accessdate=3 May 2015}}</ref>
'''3) 29 July 2015:''' Qutbuddin said that he was referred to as ''al Walad al Ahabb,'' meaning the 'beloved son'. According to him, this carried the meaning that he was the successor. Counsel Iqbal Chagla, however, suggested to him that one Hussain Dawoodbhai of Sri Lanka was also referred to as ''al Walad al Ahabb''. Qutbuddin alleged that the meaning may be the same but the context was different.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://dnasyndication.com/showarticlerss.aspx?nid=ZZXvspMsMOCU1SgaITYLM8ZGplAN5KAi0wkQGEuEWEE=|title='Attended majlis where successor was announced' - Mumbai - News {{!}} News Syndication {{!}} Content Syndication|website=dnasyndication.com|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref>
Qutbuddin also confirmed that shortly after Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin's sroke in 2011, he had called [[Qaidjoher Ezzuddin]] in London to wish the Syedna and his successor.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/mumbai/talk-of-rift-among-bohras-over-syedna-s-successor/story-cb4UkDJk2lUM1JD3RkHUkJ.html|title=Talk of rift among Bohras over Syedna’s successor|date=2013-04-15|access-date=2016-09-05}}</ref>
'''4) - 31 July 2015:''' Qutbuddin told Court he was very hurt at being prevented from visiting [[Raudat Tahera]]. Chagla asked him if there has been a single instance when he was prevented. Qutbuddin replied that he had sent his sons to visit the mausoleum a few months ago. "They were actually beaten and pushed away.<nowiki>''</nowiki> he said. But Chagla asked, "Have you personally been prevented from visiting the [[Raudat Tahera]]?<nowiki>''</nowiki>. He replied "I did not go because my security advised me not to do so.". When Chagla asked if the statement that he was prevented from visiting is incorrect, Qutbuddin said, "I don<nowiki>'t agree. I stand by my statement.''</nowiki> <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Im-hurt-at-being-barred-from-mausoleum-Syednas-uncle/articleshow/48302656.cms|title=I’m hurt at being barred from mausoleum: Syedna’s uncle - Times of India|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref>
Counsel Iqbal Chagla, showed several documents to Qutbuddin and sought his reply on whether those were written by the 52nd Dai and whether he recognized it. To some he accepted and to some he replied in the negative or sought to study them.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-challenger-to-syedna-post-claims-he-can-t-enter-raudat-tahera-2109976|title=Challenger to Syedna post claims he can't enter Raudat Tahera {{!}} Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis|date=2015-08-01|language=en-US|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref>
'''5) - 3 Aug 2015:''' Qutbuddin claimed that even his father, Syedna [[Taher Saifuddin]], had viewed him as a successor.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://epaperbeta.timesofindia.com/Article.aspx?eid=31804&articlexml=Even-my-father-viewed-me-as-a-successor-04082015005015|title=The Times Group|website=epaperbeta.timesofindia.com|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref> In an earlier hearing, he alleged that Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] had appointed him as the ''Mazoon'' and gave a sermon, at that time he said 'I was a beloved son', and this carried the meaning that he was his successor. He again reiterated the same thing by saying that it is correct that his appointment as Mazoon was done in a public sermon by the 52nd Dai.<ref name=":44">{{Cite web|url=http://afternoondc.in/city-news/syedna-burhanuddin-said-i-am-beloved-son-says-qutbuddin-during-cross-examination/article_145524|title=Syedna Burhanuddin said I am beloved son, says Qutbuddin during cross-examination|website=afternoondc.in|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref>
'''6) - 4 Aug 2015:''' Qutbuddin was asked about the exact phrase used by Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]] in his sermon on 10 Dec 1965 and when according to him, he said that you are his beloved son? Qutbuddin replied, "Al-waladul-ahabb."<ref name=":44"/> Chagla asked him whether the translation of Al-walad ul-ahabb meant ''the'' beloved son or ''my'' beloved son. Qutbuddin maintained it meant ''my'' beloved son. He was then shown paragraph 28 (a) at page 64 of his plaint where it stated "my [lit. 'the'] beloved son". Qutbuddin was questioned as to what the meaning of [lit. 'the'] was and whether he agreed that the meaning of the phrase was in fact ''the'' beloved son. Qutbuddin said that he was confused as to why he said "my" when the translation provided by his son in the plaint stated the words "[lit. 'the']". When asked whether the translation done in the plaint was incorrect, he said he was confused.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Al Jamea tus Saifiyah, London|first=|date=10 April 2016|title=Fateh Mubeen Exhibition|url=|journal=معرض الفتح المبين|volume=|issue=|doi=|pmid=|access-date=|via=}}</ref> Around more than 400 questions were asked in which the examination centered around the sermon of 52nd Dai which mentioned the word "beloved son".<ref name=":44" />
'''7) 24 Aug 2015:''' Chagla asked Qutbuddin whether Mufaddal Saifuddin and his brothers were his pupils in matters of "spiritual guidance ". He replied, "Not regularly. But only once in a while". When asked how often, he replied, "They were regular during one period of time but not later." He said Burhanuddin sent his sons to him and this was for about ten years during his reign. While he could not remember the exact period they were his pupils, Qutbuddin added that they came to him from the time of his father, the 51st Dai.
Qutbuddin later stated that "if not all then many" persons of higher spiritual value knew he was made the ''mansoos'' (successor) and even offered him ''sajda'' (prostration). He alleged that Saifuddin and his brothers used to offer him ''sajda''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Nephew-was-my-student-Syednas-uncle-tells-HC/articleshow/48657792.cms|title=Nephew was my student, Syedna’s uncle tells HC - Times of India|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref> When asked whether ''sajda'' (physical prostration) could be offered to a person other than a dai, Qutbuddin said, "Sajda is offered only to a dai or the mansoos or to a person known as one who will succeed the dai." "I remember my sisters would sometimes do so (offer him sajda). I do not remember if my brothers did it".<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-incumbent-syedna-his-brothers-were-my-pupils-for-spiritual-learning-khuzaima-qutbuddin-2118053|title=Incumbent Syedna, his brothers were my pupils for spiritual learning: Khuzaima Qutbuddin {{!}} Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis|date=2015-08-25|language=en-US|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref>
'''8) 25 Aug 2015:''' Qutbuddin stated that '''i'''n the last years of his life, late Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin was not as mentally alert as he used to be. When advocate Iqbal Chagla asked whether Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin was in full control of his mental and physical faculties till the end, Qutbuddin answered, "I felt and believed that his health had deteriorated during the last two and a half years of his life." He said Syedna Burhanuddin was "unable to function and carry out his activities as before."<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Late-Syedna-was-less-alert-in-sunset-years/articleshow/48672477.cms|title=‘Late Syedna was less alert in sunset years’ - Times of India|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref>
==== Status of case following the death of Khuzaima Qutbuddin (Plaintiff) ==== The hearings were later fixed from 22 April to 2 May 2016,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Bombay-high-court-fixes-fresh-trial-dates-in-Syedna-succession-row/articleshow/51286997.cms|title=Bombay high court fixes fresh trial dates in Syedna succession row - Times of India|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref> however, after [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]]'s death on 30 March 2016, the Bombay High Court cancelled these two dates.<ref name=":53">{{Cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-bombay-high-court-cancels-cross-examination-of-khuzaima-qutbuddin-due-to-his-death-2199109|title=Bombay High Court cancels cross examination of Khuzaima Qutbuddin due to his death {{!}} Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis|date=2016-04-07|language=en-US|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref>
According to Indian law, upon the death of a plaintiff a suit will not abate immediately upon death but rather after 90 days if no action is taken by the legal heirs or representatives of the plaintiff.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.legalservicesindia.com/article/article/no-abetment-by-parties-death-if-right-to-sue-survive-498-1.html|title=No abetment by parties death if right to sue survive|publisher=}}</ref> As Fakhruddin intends to continue the case, it is likely that such an application would be made and the case would not abate.<ref name=":53"/> Accordingly, Justice Patel also said if Fakhruddin decides that he would like to be substituted as plaintiff he will have to file a chamber summons to set aside the abatement of the suit, and that "Nobody requires an order that that the suit has abated".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/With-death-of-Syednas-uncle-his-succession-suit-abates-HC/articleshow/51717768.cms|title=With death of Syedna's uncle, his succession suit abates: HC|date=6 April 2016|author=Rosy Sequeira|work=The Times of India}}</ref> On 4 July 2016, [[Taher Fakhruddin]] reported that he has written a letter to [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] in which he mentions that he has filed a Chamber Summons in the Bombay High Court as the plaintiff in place of his late father [[Khuzaima Qutbuddin]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newkerala.com/news/2016/fullnews-85865.html|title=Leadership tangle continues to dog Dawoodi Bohra community|date=4 July 2016|author=|work=New Kerala}}</ref>
A senior counsel commented that the [[Da'i al-Mutlaq]] is not a hereditary title that can be passed on from a father to a son; it’s an appointment that is made. This is the basis on which Khuzaima Qutbuddin had challenged the naming of Mufaddal Saifuddin as the 53rd Syedna. Taher Fakhruddin will have to prove that his father had been appointed as the Syedna, and only then can he claim the same.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mid-day.com/articles/following-khuzaima-qutbuddins-death-battle-for-supremacy-in-bohra-community-takes-a-new-turn/17096171|title=Following Khuzaima Qutbuddin's death, battle for supremacy in Bohra community takes a new turn|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref> On 7 March 2017, Justice Gautam Patel allowed Taher Fakhruddin's plea to be substituted as plaintiff in this suit, stating that although [[Taher Fakhruddin]] was free to file a separate suit, including him in the current suit would save judicial time, money and valuable amounts of paper. The matter was set for direction on 25 April 2017.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/bombay-hc-relief-for-rival-claimant-to-syedna-title/articleshow/57522940.cms|title=Bombay HC relief for rival claimant to Syedna title - Times of India|work=The Times of India|access-date=2017-03-09}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-fakhruddin-can-challenge-53rd-syedna-for-post-bombay-high-court-2345858|title=Fakhruddin can challenge 53rd Syedna for post: Bombay High Court {{!}} Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis|date=2017-03-08|work=dna|access-date=2017-03-09|language=en-US}}</ref> The court then fixed the dates of 8, 11 and 12 December 2017 for the cross examination of Taher Fakhruddin.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fatemidawatlegal.com/all/bombay-high-court-october-30th-2017/|title=Bombay High Court October 30th 2017 {{!}} Fatemi Dawat Legal|website=fatemidawatlegal.com|language=en|access-date=2017-12-05}}</ref>
==== Cross Examintation of Taher Fakhruddin (Petitioner) ==== The cross examination of Taher Fakhruddin commenced on 8 December 2017.<ref name=":8">{{Cite news|url=http://www.firstpost.com/india/dawoodi-bohra-succession-case-live-updates-bombay-high-court-to-hear-case-on-8-11-and-12-december-4248371.html|title=Dawoodi Bohra Succession Case LIVE updates: Fakhruddin claims he received special knowledge meant for Dai from his father LIVE News, Latest Updates, Live blog, Highlights and Live coverage - Firstpost|date=2017-12-08|work=Firstpost|access-date=2017-12-08|language=en-US}}</ref>
'''8 December 2017:''' Anand Desai appeared for Taher Fakhruddin. The petitioner submits letters as evidence. Examination-in-chief of Fakhruddin, Anand Desai cross examined Fakhruddin aasking him the function of the ''mazoon mutlaq'' and ''mukasir'', to which he replied that "''Mazoon'' administers the oath to the believers, shows them the position of the Dai" and the "''mukasir'' does what the Dai wants them to do and that they don't have absolute authority". On the subject of ''nass'', Fakhruddin said there was no one prescribed method, but there must be a clear communication of ''nass'' in the form of a direct statement by the preceding dai to the one he confers the nass, or there must be an indication from the Dai. He further claimed that no witnesses were needed during ''nass,'' and there were historical precedents for a private ''nass''. He stated that a ''nass'' is irrevocable and final, "It can't be changed or superseded".<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-battle-for-bohri-syedna-post-goes-to-bombay-high-court-2566160|title=Battle for Bohri Syedna post goes to Bombay High Court {{!}} Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis|date=2017-12-09|work=dna|access-date=2017-12-11|language=en-US}}</ref> He was also asked as to what happens when a successor passes away before the dai. He added that 6th Dai told 7th dai who to appoint as 8th Dai; and the 28th Dai appointed the 29th Dai in accordance with the wishes of the 27th Dai.<ref name=":8" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.freepressjournal.in/mumbai/i-have-special-knowledge-to-lead-bohras-syedna-to-bombay-high-court/1184117|title=I have special knowledge to lead Bohras: Syedna to Bombay High Court {{!}} Free Press Journal|website=www.freepressjournal.in|language=en-GB|access-date=2017-12-11}}</ref>
'''22 March 2018:''' Justice Gautam Patel commented on what appeared to be contradictions between Taher Fakhruddin's written submissions and his court testimony in regard to Taher Fakhruddin's statementsthat Queen [[Arwa al-Sulayhi]] was 'to be the single witness to the nass he conferred via the Sijil-ul-Bisharat.' This contradiction was pointed out three times, following which Justice Patel expressed his impatience with the slow pace of this case into its fourth year.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.mid-day.com/articles/mumbai-high-court-judge-expresses-his-impatience-with-the-slow-pace-of-syedna-row/19228197|title=Mumbai: High Court judge expresses his impatience with the slow pace of Syedna row|date=2018-03-22|work=mid-day|access-date=2018-03-22}}</ref>
=== Gujarat High Court case === [[Gujarat High Court]] issued an interim order on 16 April 2014 prohibiting Saifuddin from acting as the 53rd Dā'ī and his supporters from dealing with the trust properties. Khuzaima filed eight [[writ]] petitions before [[Gujarat High Court]] pertaining to the succession controversy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/City/Mumbai/Syedna-row-8-petitions-in-Gujarat-HC/articleshow/33834539.cms|title=Syedna row: 8 petitions in Gujarat HC|date=17 April 2014|publisher=The Times Group|author=<!-- Staff writer(s) -->|work=The Times of India}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{cite web|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/gujarat-hc-grants-injunction-on-dawoodi-bohra-trusts-wakfs-114041601405_1.html|title=Gujarat HC grants injunction on Dawoodi Bohra trusts, Wakfs|date=16 April 2014|author=<!-- Staff writer(s) -->|work=Business Standard}}</ref> This order was rescinded to allow [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] full control over and use of all properties in Gujarat, provided that as the sole trustee, nothing is done to degenerate the value of the trust, effectively allowing him to operate as the 53rd Dai, but without granting such recognition. This situation was to remain pending the outcome of the Bombay High Court.
=== UK Charity Commission === In May 2014, Khuzaima Qutbuddin approached the UK Charity Commission<ref name=":35" /> claiming that there was no valid appointee as the [[Da'i al-Mutlaq]]. On 15 August 2014, the UK Charity Commission<ref name=":35">{{Cite web|url=https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/charity-commission|title=The Charity Commission - GOV.UK|website=www.gov.uk|access-date=2016-08-27}}</ref> altered their position in favour of Mufaddal Saifuddin. The Commission established that there is someone in office, albeit that their position is being challenged. They also stated in writing, that "our view is therefore that His Holiness Syedna Mufaddal Saifuddin is the current incumbent of the office of Dai al-Mutlaq."<ref name=":34" /> They further stated that Mufaddal Saifuddin can continue to administer the Charity until the outcome of the Bombay High Court case is known.<ref name=":34" />

Dā'ī office".<ref name=":19">{{cite web | url=http://www.afternoondc.in/city-news/union-foreign-minister-salman-khurshid/article_104192 | title=Union Foreign Minister Salman Khurshid | date=28 February 2014 | author=<!-- Staff writer(s); No by-line. --> | location=Mumbai | work=Afternoon Despatch & Courier }}</ref> * A number of prominent personalities offered their condolences to [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]] as Syedna [[Mohammed Burhanuddin]]'s son and successor.<ref name=":17" /> These personalities include Sheikh [[Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan]], Sheikh [[Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum]], [[Narendra Modi]],<ref name=":33" /> [[Mahinda Rajapaksa]], [[Nawaz Sharif]], [[Uhuru Kenyatta]], Cardinal [[Oswald Gracias]], [[Mohammad Hamid Ansari]], [[Manmohan Singh]], [[Sonia Gandhi]], [[Salman Khurshid]], Ministers, Members of Parliament, Consulates, representatives of religious communities, prominent citizens, professionals and intellectuals.<ref name=":17" /><ref name=":19" /> * Around 50,000 followers of Mufaddal Saifuddin gathered at a public ground in Mumbai to "endorse their solidarity and offer their condolences" to their "new spiritual leader". According to the official association handling the affairs of Dawoodi Bohras in Mumbai, Qutbuddin's "wrongful claim" has aggrieved community members, as they had witnessed "[[nass (Islam)|nass]]" in 2011 in Mumbai which "had [been] reaffirmed … on many occasions".<ref name="Press Conference">{{cite web | url=http://afternoondc.in/city-news/50k-dawoodi-bohras-gather-at-azad-maidan/article_102015 | title=50k Dawoodi Bohras gather at Azad Maidan | first=Philip | last=Vargese | date=31 January 2014 | website=Afternoon Despatch & Courier | location=Mumbai | accessdate=28 February 2014}}</ref> * Followers of Mufaddal Saifuddin staged peace marches and submitted a memos protesting his half brother's claim in Bhopal, Surat, and 'in various parts of the country'.<ref name="protest">{{cite web | url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bhopal/Bohras-protest-Syednas-half-brothers-claim/articleshow/29391867.cms | title=Bohras protest Syedna's half-brother's claim | work=[[The Times of India]] | publisher=[[The Times Group]] | date=26 January 2014 | author=<!-- Staff writer(s). --> }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/surat/Dawoodi-Bohras-express-solidarity-with-Dai-al-Mutlaq/articleshow/29484841.cms | work=[[The Times of India]] | title=Dawoodi Bohras expresssolidarity with Dai-al-Mutlaq | publisher=[[The Times Group]] | date=28 January 2014 | author=<!--Staff writer(s). -->}}</ref> * Professors and students and teachers of the 200-year-old Arabic teaching academy in Surat and its branches and various state heads have recognized Mufaddal Saifuddin as the successor.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-request-community-to-maintain-calm-bombay-high-court-to-parties-2070007|title=Request community to maintain calm: Bombay High Court to parties {{!}} Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis|date=2015-03-19|language=en-US|access-date=2016-09-04}}</ref>
=== Qutbuddin === * The former Chief Justice of India, AM Ahmadi, in his personal stand, accepted Khuzaima Qutbuddin as the rightful successor. ''[[The Times of India]]'' reported that "most Dawoodi Bohra back Syedna Burhanuddin's second son, Syedna Mufadda Saifuddin, and hold him as its 53rd spiritual leader".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/The-late-Syedna-wanted-his-half-brother-to-succeed-him/articleshow/31863688.cms|title='The late Syedna wanted his half-brother to succeed him'|last=Wajihuddin|first=Mohammed|date=12 March 2014|publisher=[[The Times Group]]|location=Mumbai|work=The Times of India}}</ref> There were reports that some Bohras who support Qutbuddin have been forced to swear allegiance to Saifuddin through social isolation and threats of divorce between married couples.<ref name="Mumbai Mirror">{{cite web|url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/mumbai/others/Bohras-who-refuse-to-denounce-Qutbuddin-face-boycott-threats/articleshow/30661224.cms,http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Breakaway-Dawoodi-Bohra-faction-alleges-harassment/articleshow/29874753.cms?referral=PM|title=Bohras who refuse to denounce Qutbuddin face boycott, threats|last=Punwani|first=Jyoti|date=2014-02-19|publisher=[[The Times Group]]|work=Mumbai Mirror|accessdate=2014-04-04}}</ref> A cover story on the Bohra survey revealed that most Bohras (46%) support Khuzaima over Mufaddal and many are in the community due to fear and force [http://www.mumbaimirror.com/mumbai/cover-story/Disquiet-among-Bohras/articleshow/42292382.cms]
However, the neutrality of this survey poll has been disputed<ref name=":6">{{Cite web|url=http://mzs2cents.blogspot.in/2014/11/when-polls-mislead.html?m=1|title=When polls mislead|website=mzs2cents.blogspot.in|access-date=2016-11-15}}</ref> citing reasons that it was carried out by an anonymous group, where the majority of the respondents were not Bohras, and it did not get any statistics from the [[Dawoodi Bohra]] head office in [[Mumbai]]. The survey was carried out by 399 respondents (0.0004% of community) from which a majority of respondents did not belong to the [[Dawoodi Bohra]] community, thus questioning the bias and validity of the report. Further, the article that was published in the [[Hindustan Times]] and the [[Mumbai Mirror]] had contradictory results with glaring dissimilarities among poll statistics,<ref name=":6" /> whereas the same media outlets had previously published that hundreds of thousands had gathered in support of [[Mufaddal Saifuddin]],<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://mumbaimirror.indiatimes.com/mumbai/other/Weve-lost-our-father-today/articleshow/28979465.cms?|title=‘We’ve lost our father today’ - Mumbai Mirror -|newspaper=Mumbai Mirror|access-date=2016-11-15}}</ref><ref name=":3" /> once again questioning the validity of the survey.<ref name=":6" />

'''Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Software''' is [[software]] used in the [[finance]] and [[legal]] industries to meet the legal requirements for [[financial institutions]] and other regulated entities to prevent or report [[money laundering]] activities. There are four basic types of software that address anti-money laundering: transaction monitoring systems, [[currency transaction report]]ing (CTR) systems, customer identity management systems and compliance management software.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://complyadvantage.com/knowledgebase/anti-money-laundering/anti-money-laundering-software/|title=What Is Anti Money Laundering Software? I ComplyAdvantage|last=|first=|date=|work=ComplyAdvantage|access-date=2018-07-12|language=en-US}}</ref>
==History== Anti-money laundering guidelines came into prominence globally after the [[September 11, 2001 attacks]] and the subsequent enactment of the [[USA PATRIOT Act]] in the United States and the establishment of the [[Financial Action Task Force on Money Laundering]] (FATF). By 2010 many jurisdictions globally required [[financial institutions]] to monitor, investigate and report transactions of a suspicious nature to the financial intelligence unit in their respective country.
An entire industry developed around providing software to analyze transactions in an attempt to identify transactions or patterns of transactions, called [[structuring]], which requires a [[Suspicious activity report|SAR]] filing, or other suspicious patterns that qualify for SAR reporting. Financial institutions faced penalties for failing to properly file CTR and SAR reports, including heavy fines and regulatory restrictions, even to the point of charter revocation.
==Types== There are four basic types of software addressing AML business requirements: * Transaction monitoring systems, which focus on identification of suspicious patterns of transactions which may result in the filing of [[Suspicious Activity Report]]s (SARs) or Suspicious Transaction Reports (STRs). Identification of suspicious (as opposed to normal) transactions is part of the KYC requirements. * [[Currency Transaction Report]]ing (CTR) systems, which deal with large cash transaction reporting requirements ($10,000 and over in the U.S.) * Customer identity management systems which check various negative lists (such as [[OFAC]]) and represent an initial and ongoing part of [[Know your customer]] (KYC) requirements. Electronic verification can also check against other databases to provide positive confirmation of ID such as (in the UK: electoral roll; the "share" database used by banks and credit agencies; telephone lists; electricity supplier lists; post office delivery database * Compliance software to help firms comply with AML regulatory requirements; retain the necessary evidence of compliance; and deliver and record appropriate training of relevant staff. In addition, it should have audit trails of compliance officers activities in particular pertaining to the handling of alerts raised against customer activity.
===Transaction monitoring software=== These software applications effectively monitor bank customer transactions on a daily basis and, using customer historical information and account profile, provide a "whole picture" to the bank management. Transaction monitoring can include cash deposits and withdrawals, wire transfers and ACH activity. In the bank circles, these applications are known as "AML software".
Each vendor's software works somewhat differently. Some of the modules which should be present in an AML software are: *Know Your Customer *Entity Resolution *Transaction Monitoring *Compliance Reporting *Alert based case management *Investigation Tools *Document management to hold the customer related documentation such as account opening package, customer identification documents, etc... *Delivery of AML Training *Customer due diligence checks, including electronic verification *Automated Standard operating procedures e.g. workflow engine/ *Dissemination of AML policies and procedures
===Customer Identity Management Systems=== The definition for Customer Identity Management Systems varies in different regions and jurisdictions. Most vendors include the following features in their solutions: *Sanction List Check *Politically Exposed Person (PEP) Check *False Positive Recording *Single Scan and Batch Scanning *Auditing and Reporting
===Machine learning for money laundering detection=== There are solutions based on artificial intelligence, which are characterized by much better efficiency in detecting money laundering, comparing to rule-based approach. Especially, deep neural networks are able to discover complex interdependencies between various activities performed to launder money. This translates into fewer false alarms and more accurate detection. In the near future, transaction monitoring systems will be based on machine learning rather than on rules and scenarios.<ref>{{cite journal |first=Tomasz |last=Czech |title=Deep learning: the next frontier for money laundering detection |url=https://www.globalbankingandfinance.com/deep-learning-the-next-frontier-for-money-laundering-detection/ |journal=Global Banking and Finance Review }}</ref>
